A Step-By-Step Express Entry: Canada PR from India

Immigrate to Canada from India with your family as a skilled worker. A step-by-step guide to Express Entry and the process for Canada PR from India.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” Canada PR Process from India

The prospective applicants have to go through the following steps to obtain Canada PR from India. These steps may vary depending on the immigration program.

  • Step 1: Determining Your Eligibility
  • Step 2: Verify Your Education through ECA
  • Step 3: Get Enough Score on Language Test
  • Step 4: Create Express Entry Profile
  • Step 5: Get an Invitation to Apply
  • Step 6: Medical Checkups & Police Verification
  • Step 7: Application Processing
  • Step 8: Confirmation of Permanent Residence (CoPR)
  • Step 9: Move to Canada as a Permanent Resident

Obtain Canada PR from India?” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][vc_column_text]You can get Canada PR from India within 4-6 months of the time period through various immigration programs. We will go into detail on how to apply for permanent residency in this step-by-step guide for Canada PR Visa from India.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Move to Canada from India

Start your Canada PR Process from India with our licensed experts.[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Book a consultation” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/book-consultation/”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#fafafa” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Canada PR Process: Step-by-Step from India

The Indian applicants must follow these steps for the Canada PR process from India.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”padding-2-percent” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color=”#fafafa” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Step 1: Determine Your Eligibility

The first step towards getting Canada PR from India would be checking if you qualify for any immigration programs. Check the eligibility requirements for the Canadian Express Entry which is the most common Canad PR program from India.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Step 2: Verify your Foreign Education through ECA

To demonstrate equivalency to Canadian schooling, candidates must get an Educational Credential Assessment (ECA) certificate. This can be done with the help of some designated organizations like WES.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Step 3: Take IELTS or Equivalent Language Test

The candidates will have to pass a language test to demonstrate their command of any or both of Canada’s official languages, English or French. Only government-approved language tests must be taken by the applicant to obtain Canada PR from India.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Step 4: Create an Express Entry Profile

The candidates must create an Express Entry Profile and submit an application through one of the three federal economic immigration programs via Express Entry. Alternatively, they can apply for a Provincial Nominee Program (PNP) or other economic pilot programs.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Step 5: Get an Invitation to Apply

Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) will then rank candidates based on their program scores. Indian applicants can calculate their scores beforehand using our Express Entry Points Calculator. Only candidates who have enough CRS points must receive an invitation to apply for Canada PR from India. After getting an ITA the candidates get 60 days to prepare and submit a PR Application.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Step 6: Medical Exam and Police Clearance

Complete background and medical checks – The applicant for this position must get both a police clearance certificate and a medical certificate (PCC).[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Step 7: Application Processing Stage

IRCC will assess your application for a Canada PR visa. If there are any further needs in this phase, the candidate must be prepared to give the requested information.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_id=”copr”]

Step 8: Confirmation of PR

The candidate will be given a CoPR (Confirmation of Permanent Resident) at this stage following a positive assessment of their application.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Step 9: Move to Canada

After that, you simply, fly from India to Canada to become a permanent resident.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” id=”immigration-programs” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_position=”all” bottom_margin=”0″ column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Immigration Programs for Canada PR from India” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1666788920396{margin-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1666788909305{margin-top: 40px !important;}”]There are more than 80 different immigration programs that make you eligible for Canada PR from India. These are the main immigration programs that allow an Indian to immigrate to Canada:

  • Express Entry: Move to Canada as a Skilled Worker with work experience.
  • Family Sponsorship: Bring your family members to Canada from India.
  • PNP: Become a Canadian Permanent Resident from India by being nominated by a province or territory.
  • Caregiver/Nanny Visa: Immigrate to Canada as an Indian Caregiver or Nanny.
  • Canada Investor Visa: Obtain Canada PR by investment.
  • Intra-Company Transfer Visa: A unique PR pathway for high net-worth individuals.
  • Start-Up Visa: Establish an innovative startup and get Canadian PR from India.
  • Self-Employed Visa: Establish a business in Canada by engaging in athletics or the arts.
  • Atlantic Immigration Pilot Program (AIP): Migrate to the Atlantic region of Canada
  • Quebec Immigration: Skilled worker immigration options to Quebec.
  • Rural and Northern Immigration Pilot (RNIP): Immigrate to small rural and northern Canadian communities.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” id=”eligibility-requirements” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Canada PR Requirements from India

Canada’s Federal Government introduced the Express Entry System in January 2015 as a replacement for the earlier “first come, first serve” application system. This system manages four essential immigration programs for Indians:

  • Federal Skilled Worker Program
  • Federal Skilled Trades Program
  • Canadian Experience Class
  • Provincial Nominee Programs (PNPs)

The basic Canada PR requirements from India are as follows:[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”padding-2-percent” column_padding_position=”all” top_margin=”3%” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”1. Language Skills” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1653833363001{margin-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1669385649212{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Each program within the Express System includes specific language requirements. Prospective Indian applicants must demonstrate their fluency in English or French by taking an approved Canadian Language Benchmark Test.

The minimum English or French language score required for each program is shown below:

  • Federal Skilled Worker Program: CLB 7
  • Federal Skilled Trades Program: CLB 5 in listening and speaking categories, CLB 4 for writing and reading
  • Canadian Experience Class: CLB 7 if the applicant’s NOC TEER Category is 0 or 1, CLB 5 if the applicant’s NOC TEER Category is 2 or 3.
[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”2. Work Experience” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1653832455737{margin-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1669385808213{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Express Entry PR programs also require applicants to have a minimum work experience in specific occupations. These occupations are classified using a National Occupation Classification or NOC 2021.

The occupation type for each program is shown below:

  • Federal Skilled Worker Program: Canadian or foreign work experience in TEER 0, TEER 1, TEER 2 or TEER 3 jobs.
  • Federal Skilled Trades Program: Canadian or foreign work experience in TEER 2 or TEER 3 skilled trade jobs.
  • Canadian Experience Class: Canadian work experience in NOC TEER 0, 1, 2 or 3 jobs

The amount of work experience required for each program is shown below:

  • Federal Skilled Worker Program: One full year of continuous work in the ten years preceding the application.
  • Federal Skilled Trades Program: Two full years of work completed in the five years preceding the application.
  • Canadian Experience Class: One full year in the three years preceding the application.
[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”3. Job Offer” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1653832496183{margin-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1653832508739{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]The job offer requirements for each program are summarized below:

  • Federal Skilled Worker Program: Job offer not required. Indian applicants may be eligible for extra points if they possess a valid job offer.
  • Federal Skilled Trades Program: A valid job offer is required. This job offer must be for full-time employment that is a minimum of 1 year in length. Alternatively, Indian applicants can provide a Certificate of Qualification related to a skilled trade issued by the Canadian Government.
  • Canadian Experience Class: Job offer required.
[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”4. Education” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1653823570612{margin-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1653832531703{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]There are no education requirements for the Federal Skilled Trades Program and the Canadian Experience Class.

Indian applicants applying through the Federal Skilled Worker Program must have completed secondary education or high school. These applicants can be awarded additional points if they have also completed post-secondary education.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” id=”pr-points-calculator” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/3″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”advanced” border_top_desktop=”1″ column_border_color=”#e0e0e0″ column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_highlighted_text color_type=”regular” highlight_color=”#ffc3b7″ style=”half_text”]

Canada PR Points Calculation

[/nectar_highlighted_text][vc_column_text]The immigration process to Canada is based on Comprehensive Ranking System points. A point-based system enables newcomers to evaluate in advance whether they qualify for the Canada PR from India. Additionally, it streamlines and makes visible the entire process of applying for a PR visa from India.

In order to qualify for a Canada PR through the Federal Skilled Worker Program (FSWP), skilled immigrants must receive at least 67 out of a possible 100 points. The following selection criteria are used to determine how these points are awarded:

  • Language Ability (Maximum 28 points)
  • Education (Maximum 25 points)
  • Work Experience (Maximum 15 points)
  • Age Factor (Maximum 12 points)
  • Arranged Employment (Maximum 10 points)
  • Adaptability Factor (Maximum 10 points)

An applicant can create an express entry profile if they have obtained at least 67 points for Canada Immigration. These points are given under the CRS system:

  • Core Human Capital Factor
  • Transferable Skills Factor
  • Spouse or Common-law partner Factor
  • Additional Points
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/3″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_row_inner column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner Check Your Score

Use our CRS Calculator to check your score for Canada PR from India.[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”CRS Calculator” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/crs-score-calculator/”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” id=”document-checklist” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/3″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”advanced” column_border_color=”#e0e0e0″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

List of Documents Required for Canada PR from India (Updated)

The proper documentation is a crucial step in the Canada PR process from India. A candidate needs the following documents in order to immigrate to Canada from India:

  • ECA (Educational Credential Assessment)
  • Language Test Results (IELTS, CELPIP, etc.)
  • Education Documents (such as degrees, diplomas, or certificates)
  • Identity documentation (Driving License, Aadhar Card, Pan Card)
  • Proof of funds
  • Medical Certificate & Police Clearance Certificate (PCC)
  • Passport
  • Employment Records for previous/current job
  • Offer of Employment (if applicable)
  • Letter of Employment
  • Digital Photos
  • Additional documents, as requested by the authority

Immigration Case Assessment

Find out if you have all the documents required for Canada PR from India.[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Quick Assessment” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/book-consultation/20min/”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” id=”fees” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_position=”left-right” bottom_margin=”7%” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”2/3″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”advanced” column_border_color=”#e0e0e0″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Canada PR Visa Fees in Indian Rupees

The cost of  applying for Canada PR from India through the Express Entry in 2022:

  • Application processing fee – INR 51,429.42 (CAD $850)
  • Right of Permanent Residence fee – INR 31,160.53 (CAD $515)
  • Include Spouse or partner – INR 51,429.42 (CAD $850)
  • Include a dependent child – INR 13,919.53 (CAD $230) (per child)

Additional fees for other procedures

  • IELTS Exam – INR 15,500
  • ECA fees – INR 15,500
  • Medical Exam – INR 6000
  • Police Clearance Certificate (PCC) – INR 500

In addition to these expenses, the candidate must provide proof of means of financial support in the form of bank statements, fixed deposits, etc.

These settlement funds demonstrate the candidate’s capacity to financially sustain themselves throughout their transfer to Canada as well as any accompanying family members.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_id=”processing-time”]

Canada PR Processing Time from India

Canada PR visa processing time from India varies with the type of application. It takes 6-8 months to process an application under the Express Entry system. But if you are applying from any other Canada PR Visa stream, like BC PNP, then it might take more time.

The candidates are encouraged to check the latest processing times for Canada PR from India, on IRCC’s official website.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-3-percent” Canada PR Visa from India

It is advised to start this process with registered Canadian express entry consultants only. Prospective Indian immigrants that wish to apply for Canada PR from India can reach us for consultation. Our team of immigration consultants is familiar with the Express Entry system and can guide Indian applicants in selecting the right program.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” title=”What is the difference between Express Entry and FSW?”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1652634718520{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]FSW is a type of Express Entry program. It is one of the three main economic immigration programs of Canada.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”What is the difference between FSW and PNP?”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1652635024933{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]PNP is a province-focus immigration pathway, while FSW is valid all over Canada (except Quebec). If you apply for PNP in addition to FSW you will get 600 extra points on the nomination. Although you can apply for a standalone PNP program as well. Learn more.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”How many CRS points are required for FSW in Canada?”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1652635094137{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]You typically require a minimum of 67 points out of 100 if you wish to be eligible under the Express Entry System.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”What is the general processing time for FSW in 2022?”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1652635186680{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]Generally, it takes around 6 months for Express Entry applications to be processed. But FSW applications is expected to rise to 36 months in 2022 because of over-achieved targets as per this plan by IRCC.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”What is sufficient proof of funds in FSW Program?”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1652635312136{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]

  • bank account statements in your name or in the name of the spouse/common-law partner accompanying you to Canada.
  • cashable investments that are in your name or in the name of the spouse/common-law partner accompanying you to Canada.
  • cashable fixed deposits that are in your name or the name of the spouse/common-law partner accompanying you to Canada.
